net.sourceforge.JDash.skin
Class Skin

java.lang.Object
  net.sourceforge.JDash.skin.Skin
Direct Known Subclasses:
AllParametersSkin, XMLSkin
public abstract class Skin
extends java.lang.Object

This is the abstract skin class. From this, we can get all the skinnable attributes used to define the user interface.

Constructor Detail

Skin

public Skin(SkinFactory ownerFactory)
create a new skin class. Don't do anything special in the constructor. Because you can't be sure that the necessary values are yet ready in the sEtup class. do you init in the init() method.s

Parameters:
ownerFactory - IN - the factory that created this skin
id - IN - a unique ID for this skin.

getId

public abstract java.lang.String getId()
get the unique ID of this skin. You need to try very hard to make this unique among all possible skins. I suggest you include the full package and class name in this if you can.

Returns:

getWindowStartupState

public abstract java.lang.String getWindowStartupState()
                                                throws java.lang.Exception
Get the initial window startup state. This will be one of 2 words. "fullscreen" or "window". But, the "window" value can be suffixed with a scale value. eg. "window:26" will start in window mode and scale the initial size to 26% of the screen size.

Returns:
Throws:
java.lang.Exception

getWindowSize

public abstract java.awt.Dimension getWindowSize()
                                          throws java.lang.Exception
return the original dimensions of the desired window. This is the width and height that the gauge panel will prefer to be sized to. All auto-resizing will be scaled to maintain the aspect ratio that this window size represents. When window shapes are drawn to the background window, this dimenstion defines the coords that they are drawn into.

Returns:
Throws:
java.lang.Exception

public abstract java.util.List<AbstractShape> getWindowShapes()

get the list of shapes that make up the background for the primary gauge panel.

java.lang.Exception

getImageUrl

public abstract java.net.URL getImageUrl(java.lang.String imageName)
                                  throws java.lang.Exception
Images are requested via resource names. If an image is requested, it is the job of the extended class to return the URL to the image desired according to the imageResource parameter. Once the image for the given resoure has been loaded once, it will be cached by this class, and returned from the class for all future requests.

Parameters:
imageName - IN - the name of the image to return
Returns:
the URL to the image.
Throws:
If - there was any sort of problem getting the image.
java.lang.Exception

getImage

public final javax.swing.ImageIcon getImage(java.lang.String imageName)
                                     throws java.lang.Exception
the getImage() method is final to enforce caching of images. Once an image is loaded, it's cached into a hashmap, and returned from it for future calls.

Parameters:
imageName - IN - the name of the image to be fetched.
Returns:
Throws:
java.lang.Exception

getGaugeCount

public abstract int getGaugeCount()
                           throws java.lang.Exception
return the number of gauges present in this skin. Throw an exception if a problem occurs.

Returns:
Throws:
java.lang.Exception

createGauge

public abstract AbstractGauge createGauge(int index,
                                          GaugePanel parentPanel)
                                   throws java.lang.Exception
get the guage at the given index. Throw an exception if a problem occurs. do NOT return null.

Parameters:
index - IN - the index of which gauge to create.
parentPanel - IN - the parent panel this guage will belong to
Returns:
Throws:
java.lang.Exception
